chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 25 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs are to be paid during the term of extended supervision and not from inmate account.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No contact with anyone under age 18 in a non-public place.  Not to be alone with anyone under age 18.  No contact with victim or his family, directly or indirectly.  Prohibited from working or volunteering in any endeavor that would require contact with persons under age 16.  Comply with sex offender assessment and treatment.  Obey special rules imosed by DOC for sex offenders.  Must register for the sex offender registry for life.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey L Hineman

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted.  The State's reply brief shall be served and filed on or before October 21, 2022.  In light of the approaching November 8, 2022 oral argument date, absolutely no further extensions will be considered or granted.
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted.  The brief submitted with the motion is accepted as filed.
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. Mr. Hineman's response brief shall be served and filed on or before September 30, 2022.

IT IS ORDERED that the parties may refer to the January 19, 2018 version of the transcript in their briefs; and, 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that defendant-appellant's response brief shall be served and filed on or before September 16, 2022.
Request to the court of appeal for clarification on the due date of this supplement and which version of the transcript to include.
Order to Supplement the Record with the January 19, 2019 version of the May 11, 2017 transcript

ORD that the Clerk of the Supreme Court shall place Volume II of the Appendix to laintiff-respondent-petitioner, State of Wisconsin's opening brief in this matter under seal.  It shall remain sealed until further order of the court.
ORD that the motion is granted. The State's opening brief shall be served and filed on or before 06/24/2022
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. The State's opening brief shall be served and filed on or before June 10, 2022.

IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is granted and that pursuant to Wis. Stat Section (rule) 809.626(6), the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner may not raise or argue issues not set forth in the petition for review unless otherwise ordered by the court; and 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to Wis. Stat  sections (Rules) 809.62(6) and 809.63, within 30 days after the date of this order the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner must file a brief in this court; that within 20 days of filing the defendant-appellant, Jeffrey L. Hineman, must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that if a brief is filled by the defendant-appellant, within 10 days of filing the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief or petition for review or response; instead, any material in these documents upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief filed in this court; and 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the first brief filed in this court must contain, as part of the appendix, a copy of the decision of the court of appeals in this case; and 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if a party has not previously filed an electronic copy of the briefs filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals, the party, within 30 days after the date of this order, must provide the clerk of this court with 10 copies of the brief previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals; but if the party has already filed an electronic copy of such briefs, then there is no obligation to provide additional copies of those briefs to the clerk of this court; and 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the allowance of costs, if any, in connection with the granting of the petition will abide the decision of this court on review.
Petition for Review
Recusal

Ct 1: 948.02(1)(a): 1st Degree Sexual Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13.

      ****TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING****
Jury instruction list

Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers and Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Jury enters, the Court gives instructions. Ms. Sommers gives closing arguments for the State. Defense gives closing arguments. Ms. Sommers gives rebuttal for the State. The Court gives final instructions to the jury. Oath #4 is given. Names are tumbled, alternate chosen. Juror #10 is chosen as alternate. The jury begins deliberations at 9:31 am
Jury question, parties assembled. Verdict has been reached: 1:11 pm

The jury finds the defendant guilty. The jury is polled
The State moves for judgment on the verdict. The State moves that the deft be held without bond pending sentencing. The Defense opposes judgment on verdict

BTC: guilty. Motion to revoke bond is granted. Deft to be held w/o bond pending sentencing. PSI ordered
#4 CD
#2 CD
#1-CV of Heather Johnson

#1-CV of Heather Johnson
#2-Copy of CAC video
#3-NOT OFFERED
#4-Copy of Inv. Hintz interview with deft
Box #273

Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers and Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that there are other allegations on the CAC tape that haven't been subject to 904.04 analysis and there was not an other acts motion. Defense requests that the entire video be played. The Court conducts a colloquy with Defense and with the defendant. The Defendant also wishes for the entire tape be played.  BTC: The entire CAC tape may be shown. Jury enters at 8:50 am, Oath #2 given. Preliminary instructions given to the jury by the Court. Mr. Van Schyndel gives opening statements for the Court. Atty Henry reserves her right to give her opening statement. The State calls forensic interviewer Heather Jensen - DSAT. Direct by Mr. Van Schyndel for the State.  State marks Ex #1-CV of Heather Jensen. State moves Ex #1 into evidence/received. Defense marks Ex #2-copy of CAC video. State moves DVD into evidence/received. Cross xam by Defense. Ms. Sommers, for the State, calls SS however, prior to SS being on the stand, the State plays the CAC interview. SS - DSAT. Direct by State. Cross xam by Defense. Mr. Van Schyndel, for the State, calls MS - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Defense. The State calls Inv. Tracy Hintz - DSAT. Direct by Ms. Sommers for the State. The Defense objects to the line of questioning/answers by the State with this witness based on the State's failure to file a notice of expert testimony therefore: BTC: the line of questioning is not allowed.
State recalls Inv. Hintz; remains under oath. Cross xam by defense. Defense marks Ex #3-supplemental report from CAC. Exhibits 1 & 2 being received; the State rests and reserves its right to present a rebuttal case. Defense moves for dismissal w/o argument. The State objects-argument put on the record. BTC: motion to dismiss is denied.

The defendant will testify; the Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to testify and his right to remain silent. Defense calls JH - DSAT. Direct by the defense. Cross xam by Ms. Sommers for the State. Ms. Sommers, for the State, recalls Inv. Hintz on rebuttal. Direct by Ms. Sommers for the State. State marks Ex #4-copy of Inv Hintz interview with deft. State moves Ex #4 into evidence/received and published.The State rests their case in rebuttal. Both sides now rest. Evidence is now closed. The jury is released for the day. Parties review instructions to be given to jury.

Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in court with attorney Aileen Henry.  Defendant Jeffrey L Hineman in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers and Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The final offer is pl to charge, the State recommends prison-time left to the Courts discretion. The defendant rejects the offer. Parties are prepared for trial.
Jury enters, Oath #1 given. The Court greets the jury. Ms. Sommers, for the State, introduces self and other attorneys in their office. Ms. Henry introduces self and deft. Voir dire by the Court. Voir dire by Ms. Sommers for the State. Voir dire by Ms. Henry for the Defense. Parties exercise their peremptory challenges. No objection to the panel as chosen. Sidebars put on the record. Jurors admonished and released for the evening.  Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on May 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, SJS (person, property, residence or family). No unsupervised contact w/any minor children. Supervised contact must be done w/an adult.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
